intro: Linnaeobreynia pulcherrima, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a velvety texture, while its stems are sturdy and branching. Linnaeobreynia pulcherrima is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and is adapted to well-drained soils and full sun.
